name: places/ChIJ6QO5CXpZwokRjNRbUmTabY4
formattedAddress: 746 E 9th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 746 E 9th St, New York, NY 10009-5334, USA

originalText.text:
Sadly i use to work for them in the Residential and commercial service department and they had the best technicians back in 2010-2012. Their PM at the time in 2012 was so-so but yet shady.
The owners themselves, can't say they cared much but now it seems they really don't have the interest of finding better quality techs and giving better pay to those who actually put in the quality work they due.
Hope they pull out from this slump soon. They need to be what the use to be in their golden era.

originalText.text: Do not buy a Simon-Aire unit. Bought several years ago. Never worked well. Serviced 5 times first year. Then, I just gave up. I try not to use it. Does not cool or heat properly. Stops too early. Replaced and moved sensor numerous times. Uggh.. Hate it and Figlia don't seem to know how to fix their own units. Not reputable. Stay away.

originalText.text: This company is a shame… how can they make such a terrible product? It simply does NOT work

text.text: This company is a shame… how can they make such a terrible product? It simply does NOT work

originalText.text:
Simon-Aire PTAC in 5 years:
-3 FAN REPLACEMENTS(4th fan in 5 years)
-1 FREON LEAK
-CHRONIC COMPRESSOR ISSUES

I purchased a supposedly new Simon-Aire PTAC from Figlia which is their in-house brand. I normally don't write reviews good or bad, but Figlia & Sons and Simon-Aire deserve special recognition.

In YEAR 1 of the AC's operation, in addition to continuous compressor errors there was 1 freon leak, and 1 broken fan. Note: The unit is serviced and cleaned annually by my building's staff and an outside service.

In YEAR 3, the unit stopped working again due to a 2nd broken fan costing me an additional $200.00 for the part. Figlia's manager, CHRIS B., said the former fan blades were flawed and the new replacement would not break since he was involved in the fan's redesign. At the time, Chris B offered an additional 9 month warranty for my second fan replacement. I requested a two year warranty and he emailed,"Let's take one step at time right now your covered for the next 12 M. If problem continues I will deal with it at that time .."

In YEAR 5, the fan blade broke for the 3rd time, costing another $200.00 for the part. I've reached out to CHRIS B. over a dozen times and he will neither personally address this issue via phone nor email. Perhaps CHRIS B. is really busy redesigning and re engineering the fan again.

CHRIS B. finally had his HR manager contact me by email. While disregarding my repair questions, she proclaimed his good faith in offering an extended warranty on their 2nd fan replacement. Well, that fan just broke and I just paid Figlia for my 3rd replacement. It'd be helpful to hear from a technician, a repairman, or an engineer, but instead CHRIS B had the HR manager email me touting his generosity. That's right... Figlia had the HR manager address my repair issues.

I've requested to speak with someone at Figlia about about possible mechanical, misalignment, or installation issues causing the fan to break so frequently. Still no response... Maybe the PTAC would be durable if it had a backbone. I'd prefer to inspect, assess, and repair the unit, rather than continue to pay $200+ every year for a replacement fan.

Among other issues, 4 fans in 5 years is telling. Is Figlia obligated to offer any further assistance? No - However I would expect better from a $2000.00 Simon-Aire PTAC and the company manufacturing, selling, and servicing this brand.

originalText.text: Everyone deserves an opportunity. And Renita, Robbie, Chris, Ryan....entire family were provided one. Unfortunately, time and time again they have failed to come through. Customer service is a zero and product is sub par. Maybe you’ll have a better experience? Isolated instances are okay. Trends are not. You decide for yourself.
